title: Christine and Frank Lampard enjoy rare outing with daughter Patricia, 13 months
text:
She recently admitted she met her now-husband by complete chance at the 2009 Pride of Britain Awards.

And ten years on, Christine and Frank Lampard looked every inch the perfect couple as they enjoyed a rare family outing with their daughter Patricia, 13 months, in London on Sunday morning.

The Loose Women panellist, 40, and Chelsea F.C.'s manager, 41, treated themselves to some time away from their busy schedules as they embarked on a casual stroll with their adorable baby girl in the English capital.

Family first: Christine and Frank Lampard looked every inch the perfect couple as they enjoyed a rare outing with daughter Patricia, 13 months, in Battersea, south-west London, on Sunday

Christine and Frank - who have been married since 2015 - were in their element as they sipped on cups of coffee during their low-key walk with their toddler and their Havanese dog Minnie.

Opting for comfort, the presenter donned a black raincoat by Nike and clingy running tights, which she teamed with classic trainers.

The Northern Irish host wore her brunette tresses in loose waves and ditched her signature make-up look in favour of a minimal appearance.

Former midfielder Frank, meanwhile, shielded his face underneath a navy baseball cap while wrapping warm in a padded jacket, a grey hoodie and tracksuit bottoms.

The important things in life: The Loose Women panellist, 40, and Chelsea F.C.'s manager, 41, treated themselves to some time away from their busy schedules

Off they go: The couple embarked on a casual stroll with their adorable baby girl and their Havanese dog Minnie in the English capital

Refreshing: Christine and Frank - who have been married since 2015 - were in their element as they sipped on cups of coffee during their low-key walk

Earlier this week, Christine lifted the lid on how she first met sportsman Frank, and sweetly gushed their daughter Patricia has 'completed' them.

Christine and Frank have been together since meeting at the 2009 Pride of Britain Awards in October, and tied the knot in a romantic ceremony at St Paul's Church, Knightsbridge, in December 2015.

The ITV star, who is on the judging panel of the 2019 Pride of Britain Awards, revealed why the awards ceremony is a special night for them.

She told the Mirror: 'It was a complete Sliding Doors moment, I still remember the first meeting as clear as day. Who goes to an awards ceremony and finds a husband? That was me!

Dressed down: Opting for comfort, the presenter donned a black raincoat by Nike and clingy running tights, which she teamed with classic trainers

Casual: The Northern Irish host wore her brunette tresses in loose waves and ditched her signature make-up look in favour of a minimal appearance

Equally low-key: Former midfielder Frank shielded his face underneath a navy baseball cap while wrapping warm in a padded jacket, a grey hoodie and tracksuit bottoms

'Neither of us were even meant to go and I was late after hosting The One Show. So when we are there now we do have a celebratory glass of champagne. It’s a special evening for us.'

Talking about her daughter, Christine enthused: 'We were already really happy but I suppose it does complete things. I mean, goodness me, I still look at her now, a year old, and I honestly can’t quite believe she’s mine.'

In addition to Patricia, Christine is also stepmother to Frank's daughters Luna, 14, and Isla, 12, from his former relationship with Elen Rivas.

The media personality recently discussed how her body has changed since welcoming her baby daughter Patricia almost a year ago.

How adorable: Patricia pulled a cheeky facial expression as she was held by doting mother Christine

Teamwork makes the dream work: The ex-footballer carried their pet pooch while the former This Morning presenter folded her daughter's buggy into their car

Quality time: The power couple engaged in a cosy conversation as they enjoyed their weekend

She spoke to Fabulous about her figure, life as a mum and how her body has changed since giving birth - as she revealed she has put on a stone and gone up a shoe size.

She said: 'I’m wider all round [my waist and hips]. And I’ve gone up a shoe size since I had her! I could do more to try to trim myself back in, but I don’t care.'

'I’m enjoying her and I enjoy a glass of rosé. I mean come on, it’s the summer! I can’t say no to any of it.'

After years of being pressured to start a family, Christine hit back: 'I didn’t give a s**t [about the pressure]. I just never got why it was a question. Whose business is it? And what difference does it make to anybody other than me?
description: The host, 40, and Chelsea F.C.'s manager, 41, looked every inch the perfect couple as they enjoyed a rare family outing with their daughter Patricia, 13 months, in Battersea on Sunday.
